page.title: 09FARMING.A FARM IN CLAPHAM
page.content: The Bull and Cave farm is to the south western side of the village.The farm was built in 1725 so it is 260 years old.It is an big farm,it has around 450 acres,made up of 2 farms.The farm house used to be a public house.There are 6 beef bulls, 1 breeding bull,and 125 bullocks the cattle are cross between Aberdeen Angus and Friesens,they were black,Mr.Nelson makes his own hay and silo around June to July,these are the busiest times as well as lambing.In winter they feed their animals on hay,silo and barley,and straw is brought for bedding.Mr.Nelson has worked on the farm for thirty years,and there are two other men employed there most of the time.Mr.Nelson works ten hours a day and seven days aweek.There are 3 tractors and 1 truck,and a lot of machinery for bailing,siloing etc.
